title: 10 Non-Hybrid Crossovers and SUVs That Get 30 MPG or More
text: Fuel efficiency, cargo space, and a cheap price make up the triple threat combo for the ever-popular crossover SUV segment. It’s a group that starts off cheap but quickly rolls into a higher price bracket once the options start getting tacked on, but this is the solution automakers have come up with to pack storage into a cheap ute that can still achieve an EPA combined rating of at least 30 mpg. Although they lack spaciousness, cars still beat the crossovers in terms of overall fuel economy, but that hasn’t stopped some manufacturers from shrinking their compact-car lineup in the meantime to soak up potential SUV sales. Here are the most fuel-efficient crossovers that don’t seek help from electric-motors to achieve the highest combined fuel economy according to the EPA.
